00:00:04:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:04:030000.Dialogue: I asked for turkey and roast beef with lettuce and Swiss on whole wheat.

00:00:18:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:18:020000.Dialogue: It's the right ingredients, but in the wrong order.

00:00:21:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:21:180000.Dialogue: In a proper sandwich, the cheese is adjacent to the bread to create a moisture barrier against the lettuce.

00:00:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:28:150000.Dialogue: They might as well have dragged this thing through a car wash.

00:00:36:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:36:060000.Dialogue: Some guy is auctioning off a miniature Time Machine prop from the original film, and no one is bidding on it.

00:00:41:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:41:120000.Dialogue: A time machine from the movie The Time Machine?

00:00:44:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:44:180000.Dialogue: No. A time machine from Sophie's Choice.

00:00:47:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:47:220000.Dialogue: Boy, Sophie could have used a time machine in that movie. Did you see it? It's rough.

00:01:00:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:00:010000.Dialogue: It was a spur-of-the-moment thing. I figured it would go for thousands, and I just wanted to be a part of it.

00:01:05:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:05:030000.Dialogue: There's only 30 sec left in the auction.

00:01:08:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:08:110000.Dialogue: Not to blow on a miniature time machine.

00:01:10:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:10:200000.Dialogue: Don't worry. People wait until the last second to bid, and they swoop in and get it. It's called sniping.

00:01:30:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:30:200000.Dialogue: Congratulations! You are the proud owner of a miniature time machine!

00:01:37:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:37:170000.Dialogue: I wonder why no one else bid. This is a classic piece of sci-fi movie memorabilia.

00:01:42:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:42:000000.Dialogue: Why don't we share it? We'll each put in 200 bucks, we'll take turns having it in our house.

00:01:53:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:53:090000.Dialogue: Need you ask? I still don't understand why no one else bid.

00:02:06:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:06:180000.Dialogue: I understand why no one else bid.

00:02:37:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:37:100000.Dialogue: Did the listing actually say miniature?

00:02:44:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:44:230000.Dialogue: Who sells a full-size time machine for $800?

00:02:49:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:49:010000.Dialogue: In a Venn diagram, that would be an individual located within the intersection of the sets No longer want my time machine and Need $800.

00:02:58:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:58:030000.Dialogue: It's actually a tremendous bargain. Even with shipping, it works out to less than four dollars a pound.

00:03:09:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:09:000000.Dialogue: How are we going to get it upstairs?

00:03:12:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:12:090000.Dialogue: If we take the dish off, it might fit in the elevator.

00:03:15:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:15:070000.Dialogue: Yes, but the elevator has been broken for 2 years.

00:03:17:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:17:190000.Dialogue: I've been meaning to ask you. Do you think we should make a call about that?

00:03:23:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:23:060000.Dialogue: Not necessary. I have a Master's in engineering. I remotely repair satellites on a regular basis. I troubleshoot space shuttle payloads. When the Mars Rover started pulling to the left, I performed a front-end alignment from 62 million miles away.

00:03:54:190000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:03:54:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:56:060000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:03:56:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:56:060000.Dialogue: If I push any harder, I'm going to give birth to my colon.

00:04:00:150000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:00:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:00:150000.Dialogue: I can't feel my fingers. Hurry up!

00:04:02:160000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:02:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:02:160000.Dialogue: It's the same amount of work no matter how fast you go. Basic physics.

00:04:05:040000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:05:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:05:040000.Dialogue: Sheldon? If my fingers ever work again, I've got a job for the middle one.

00:04:12:110000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:12:110000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:17:140000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:17:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:20:110000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:20:110000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:24:020000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:24:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:29:030000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:29:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:29:030000.Dialogue: Neat. But I really got to get to work.

00:04:31:040000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:31:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:31:040000.Dialogue: I don't have them. I'm running late.

00:04:34:060000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:34:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:34:060000.Dialogue: Then, I have a simple solution. Go up to the roof. Hop over to the next building. There's a small gap, don't look down if you're subject to vertigo, and use their stairwell.

00:04:43:040000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:43:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:44:130000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:44:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:44:130000.Dialogue: I never joke when it comes to vertigo.

00:04:48:210000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:48:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:48:210000.Dialogue: Damn. Okay, I'll just take the roof.

00:04:52:050000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:52:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:52:050000.Dialogue: If you wait for us to set up the time machine, I can drop you off at work yesterday.

00:04:58:060000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:04:58:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:58:060000.Dialogue: Time travel joke. It's not... never mind.

00:05:02:120000.Scene: The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
00:05:02:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:02:120000.Dialogue: For what it's worth, I thought it was humorous.

00:05:08:190000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:05:08:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:08:190000.Dialogue: Let's just do this. You guys ready to push?

00:05:10:120000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:05:10:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:10:120000.Dialogue: In a minute. Howard stepped outside to throw up.

00:05:14:000000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.

00:05:20:150000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:05:20:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:20:150000.Dialogue: I don't know what you were worried about. I think it really works in the room.

00:05:26:160000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:05:26:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:26:160000.Dialogue: It is by far the coolest thing I have ever owned.

00:05:29:150000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:05:29:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:29:150000.Dialogue: The exact time machine that carried actor Rod Taylor from Victorian England into the post-apocalyptic future, where society had splintered into two factions: the subterranean Morlocks, who survived by feasting on the flesh of the gentle surface-dwelling Eloi.

00:05:45:130000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:05:45:130000.Speaker: Howard

00:05:51:060000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:05:51:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:51:060000.Dialogue: The guy who lives next to me is always like, I have a Jacuzzi on my balcony. I have a Jacuzzi on my balcony. But wait until I tell him, I've got a time machine on my balcony.

00:06:02:020000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:02:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:02:020000.Dialogue: Stuff that in your Speedoes, Jacuzzi Bob.

00:06:05:200000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:05:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:05:200000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, we said we'd take turns, but I think you'll agree that practicality dictates it remain here.

00:06:11:150000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:11:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:11:150000.Dialogue: You can't keep it here. What if I meet a girl and say, You wanna come up and see my time machine? It's at my friends' house. How lame is that?

00:06:18:220000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:18:220000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:20:040000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:20:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:20:040000.Dialogue: I think we're going to need some ground rules; in addition to the expected no shoes in the time machine, and no eating in the time machine, I propose we add pants must be worn at all times in the time machine.

00:06:31:070000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:31:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:33:130000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:33:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:33:130000.Dialogue: I was going to put down a towel.

00:06:39:020000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:39:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:39:020000.Dialogue: I still want it on my balcony. I say we move it on a bi-monthly basis.

00:06:43:050000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:43:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:48:080000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:48:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:50:030000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:50:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:53:140000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:06:53:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:53:140000.Dialogue: You can't be selfish. We all paid for it, so it belongs to all of us. Now get out of the way so I can sit in my time machine.

00:07:10:070000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:10:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:10:070000.Dialogue: I am setting the dials for March 10, 1876.

00:07:14:130000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:14:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:14:130000.Dialogue: Good choice, Alexander Graham Bell invents the telephone and calls out for Dr. Watson.

00:07:17:010000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:17:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:17:010000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. I'd want to see that, too.

00:07:19:060000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:19:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:19:060000.Dialogue: So when it's your turn, you can.

00:07:21:230000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:21:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:21:230000.Dialogue: But if we all go back to the same point, Bell's lab is going to get very crowded. He'll know something's up.

00:07:27:220000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:27:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:27:220000.Dialogue: Also since the time machine doesn't move in space, you'll end up in 1876 Pasadena.

00:07:32:090000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:32:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:32:090000.Dialogue: And even if you can make it to Boston, are you going knock on the door and say to Mrs. Bell, Big fan of your husband. Can I come in and watch him invent the telephone?

00:07:40:030000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:40:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:40:030000.Dialogue: Mrs. Bell was deaf. She's not even going to hear you knock.

00:07:44:020000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:44:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:44:020000.Dialogue: I have a solution. First, go into the future and obtain a cloaking device.

00:07:46:190000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:46:190000.Speaker: Raj

00:07:49:180000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:07:49:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:49:180000.Dialogue: If I remember correctly, Captain Kirk will steal a cloaking device from the Romulans on Stardate 5027.3, which would be January 10, 2328 by pre-Federation reckoning.

00:08:01:150000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:08:01:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:01:150000.Dialogue: I am setting the dials for January 10, 2328. Here we go into the future.

00:08:29:220000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:08:29:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:32:080000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:08:32:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:08:34:190000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:08:34:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:34:190000.Dialogue: Okay, first of all, what you call a gap was nearly three feet wide. I slipped and skinned my knee.

00:08:38:230000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:08:38:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:42:010000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:08:42:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:42:010000.Dialogue: Second of all, the door to the stairwell of the other building was locked, so I had to go down the fire escape, which ends on the 3d floor, forcing me to crawl through the window of a lovely Armenian family who insisted I stay for lunch.

00:08:54:020000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:08:54:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:01:040000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:01:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:01:040000.Dialogue: Not done. By the time I finally got to work, they'd given my shift away. That's right. I lost an entire day's pay thanks to this. This...

00:09:08:210000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:08:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:14:040000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:14:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:14:040000.Dialogue: The lights flash and the dish spins. You want to try it?

00:09:17:230000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:17:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:17:230000.Dialogue: I don't want to try it! My God, you are grown men! How can you waste your lives with these stupid toys and costumes and comic books and now that?! That...

00:09:28:140000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:28:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:32:120000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:32:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:32:120000.Dialogue: Please, it's not a time machine. If anything, it looks like something Elton John would drive through the Everglades.

00:09:43:180000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:43:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:43:180000.Dialogue: It only moves in time. It would be worse than useless in a swamp.

00:09:53:230000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:09:53:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:53:230000.Dialogue: Pathetic! All of you! Completely pathetic!

00:10:02:200000.Scene: The living room. The time machine is set up.
00:10:02:200000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:20:180000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:20:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:23:210000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:23:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:24:210000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:24:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:29:110000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:29:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:29:110000.Dialogue: Why did you set it for the day before yesterday?

00:10:32:080000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:32:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:32:080000.Dialogue: Because I want to go back and keep myself from getting a time machine.

00:10:36:000000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:36:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:36:000000.Dialogue: You can't. If you were to prevent yourself from buying it in the past, you wouldn't have it available in the present to travel back and stop yourself from buying it. Ergo, you would still have it. This is a classic rookie time-travel mistake.

00:10:50:010000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:50:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:50:010000.Dialogue: Can I go back and prevent you from explaing that to me?

00:10:53:190000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:10:53:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:53:190000.Dialogue: Same paradox. If you were to travel back in time and, say, knock me unconscious, you would not then have the conversation that irritated you, motivating you to go back and knock me unconscious.

00:11:04:040000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:04:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:04:040000.Dialogue: What if I knocked you unconscious right now?

00:11:08:010000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:08:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:11:140000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:11:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:11:140000.Dialogue: But it'd make the present so much nicer.

00:11:15:060000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:15:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:17:190000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:17:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:20:080000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:20:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:20:080000.Dialogue: Well, it was a number of things. First, the late hour. Then your demeanor seems very low-energy, plus your irritability.

00:11:25:170000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:25:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:28:160000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:28:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:28:160000.Dialogue: I don't usually pick up on those things.

00:11:31:150000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:31:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:35:230000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:35:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:38:010000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:38:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:38:010000.Dialogue: Wait. Did you want to talk about what's bothering you?

00:11:44:150000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:44:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:52:220000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:52:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:52:220000.Dialogue: Here's the thing. Girls like Penny never end up with guys who own time machines.

00:11:59:050000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:11:59:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:59:050000.Dialogue: I disagree. Your inability to successfully woo Penny long predates your acquisition of the time machine.

00:12:08:060000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:12:08:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:08:060000.Dialogue: That failure clearly stands on its own.

00:12:12:010000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:12:12:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:28:000000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:12:28:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:37:070000.Scene: Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
00:12:37:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:40:170000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:12:40:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:42:060000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:12:42:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:42:060000.Dialogue: If I push any harder, I'm going to give birth to my colon.

00:12:47:160000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:12:47:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:52:170000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:12:52:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:55:100000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:12:55:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:00:200000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:00:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:00:200000.Dialogue: Neat, but I really gotta get to work.

00:13:03:120000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:03:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:11:060000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:11:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:13:200000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:13:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:13:200000.Dialogue: But... what about your time machine?

00:13:15:210000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:15:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:15:210000.Dialogue: Some things are more important than toys.

00:13:27:030000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:27:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:28:190000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:28:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:28:190000.Dialogue: Don't worry, baby. I've got you.

00:13:52:140000.Scene: The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
00:13:52:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:02:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:02:120000.Dialogue: I'm packing up all my collectibles and taking them down to the comic book store to sell.

00:14:07:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:07:070000.Dialogue: Was that really necessary? If you need money, you can always sell blood.

00:14:19:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:19:120000.Dialogue: Lox and bagels, the breakfast of time-travelers.

00:14:22:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:22:220000.Dialogue: Terrific. Does anyone want to buy my share of the time machine?

00:14:30:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:30:070000.Dialogue: My Spidey sense tells me this has something to do with Penny.

00:14:33:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:33:180000.Dialogue: Look, do you want to buy me out or not?

00:14:36:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:36:050000.Dialogue: I'll give you $100, which will make me half-owner and we'll put it on my balcony.

00:14:40:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:40:060000.Dialogue: Screw his balcony. I'll give you $120 and we'll put it in my garage.

00:14:45:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:45:050000.Dialogue: Dude, everybody knows a time machine loses half its value the minute you drive it off the lot.

00:14:50:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:50:070000.Dialogue: I'll go for $200. That time machine stays right where it is.

00:14:53:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:53:040000.Dialogue: $300 and I'll throw in my original 1979 Mattel Millennium Falcon with real light speed sound effects.

00:14:59:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:59:040000.Dialogue: No. No more toys or action figures or props or replicas or costumes or robots or Darth Vader voice changers. I'm getting rid of all of it.

00:15:09:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:09:120000.Dialogue: You can't do that. Look what you've created here. It's like nerdvana.

00:15:16:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:16:230000.Dialogue: More importantly, you have a Darth Vader voice changer?

00:15:23:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:23:030000.Dialogue: I call dibs on The Golden Age Flash.

00:15:24:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:24:230000.Dialogue: I need that to complete my Justice Society of America collection.

00:15:30:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:30:040000.Dialogue: I can and I did. Look up Dibs in Wikipedia.

00:15:33:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:33:080000.Dialogue: Dibs doesn't apply in a bidding war.

00:15:35:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:35:090000.Dialogue: It's not a bidding war. I'm selling it all to Larry down at the comic book store.

00:15:42:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:42:040000.Dialogue: He offered me a fair price for the whole collection.

00:15:44:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:44:140000.Dialogue: What's the number? I'll match it.

00:15:52:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:52:220000.Dialogue: Mom? My bar mitzvah bonds. How much do I got? Thanks. I can go $2,600 and two trees in Israel.

00:16:01:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:01:080000.Dialogue: Forget it, guys. If I sell to one of you, the other two are going to be really mad at me.

00:16:05:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:05:120000.Dialogue: Who cares? As long as you pick me!

00:16:08:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:08:170000.Dialogue: Okay, Leonard, put down the box. Let's talk.

00:16:10:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:10:220000.Dialogue: Sorry, Raj. My mind is made up.

00:16:13:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:13:030000.Dialogue: No! I can't let you do this.

00:16:29:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:29:070000.Dialogue: I did not want to do this, but I have here the rare mint condition production error Star Trek: The Next Generation Geordi La Forge without his visor in the original packaging. If you do not get out of my way, I will open it.

00:16:55:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:55:160000.Dialogue: Little Miss grown-ups don't play with toys. If I were to go into that apartment now, would I not find Beanie Babies? Are you not an accumulator of Care Bears and My Little Ponies? And who is that Japanese feline I see frolicking on your shorts? Hello, Hello Kitty!

00:17:14:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:14:110000.Dialogue: Okay, look, if this is about yesterday, Leonard, I am really sorry about what I said. I was just upset.

00:17:19:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:19:150000.Dialogue: No, you didn't. You are a great guy and it is the things you love that make you who you are.

00:17:26:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:26:080000.Dialogue: I guess that makes me large breasts.

00:17:33:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:33:070000.Dialogue: Still, I think it's time for me to get rid of this stuff and, you know, move on with my life.

00:17:45:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:45:140000.Dialogue: Thanks. Do you want to... I don't know, later...

00:18:05:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:05:150000.Dialogue: My turn on the time machine!

00:18:30:010000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:18:30:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:32:230000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:18:32:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:32:230000.Dialogue: It really worked. They said I was mad, but it worked!

00:18:46:220000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:18:46:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:46:220000.Dialogue: Not Morlocks! Not flesh-eating Morlocks! Help!

00:19:01:140000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:19:01:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:19:04:070000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:19:04:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:04:070000.Dialogue: We have to get rid of the time machine.

00:19:06:220000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:19:06:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:06:220000.Dialogue: It is a little big for the living room, isn't it?

00:19:10:040000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:19:10:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:10:040000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's the problem. It's too big.

00:19:13:050000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:19:13:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:13:050000.Dialogue: I'm glad you agree. I hired some guys to help us move it. Come on in, fellas.

00:19:21:190000.Scene: A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
00:19:21:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
